name: Restrained Elegance
philosophy: Extreme restraint lets the data command attention. A signature warm background provides distinctive identity. Line charts serve as the primary vehicle for showing change over time. Multiple series compared with clear differentiation through color alone. Annotations minimal but precisely placed at inflection points only. Professional gravitas appropriate for financial and business audiences. Charts work beautifully at print column width. Emphasis achieved through prominence, not decoration.
layout_principles: Chart area on white, framed by warm background
Minimal but precise grid lines in muted tones
Line charts prioritized for time series
Axis labels rotated if needed for readability
One series in black or bold if it's the focus
annotation_style: Minimal, surgical. Annotations only at critical inflection points. Short phrases, not sentences. Data points labeled directly. Use thin rules to connect annotation to data. No boxes or backgrounds on annotations. Let the data speak—annotations are whispers, not shouts. End-of-line series labels preferred over legends.
gemini_modifiers:
STYLE INSTRUCTIONS (Restrained Elegance):
- Use SIGNATURE color scheme: warm salmon/cream background (#fff1e5), white chart area
- Primary series in deep blue (#0f5499), secondary in burgundy (#990f3d)
- RESTRAINT is key—minimal annotation, let data speak
- Prioritize LINE CHARTS for time series data
- Direct labeling at line endpoints, no legend if possible
- Thin, muted grid lines (#cec6b9) if needed
- Sans-serif typography for labels
- Source attribution bottom left
- Works at small size—readable at 300px width
- Maximum 3-4 series for clarity
- One series can be emphasized in black/bold
- Annotations as short phrases at inflection points only
- Professional, financial gravitas
- No decorative elements whatsoever

renderer_guidance.accordion: Section headers restrained — warm salmon tint (#fff1e5) for subtle distinction. Left accent bars thin (2px) in deep blue (#0f5499) or burgundy (#990f3d). Section descriptions as brief, authoritative annotations.
renderer_guidance.chip_grid: Chips in muted tones — deep blue and burgundy from palette. Size variation subtle, not dramatic. Expanded panels clean and compact. Professional gravitas in all typography choices.
renderer_guidance.prose: Lede paragraph in serif (Georgia), slightly larger, weight 600. Body text compact with tight line-height (1.35). Blockquotes with thin left border in deep blue, minimal indentation. No background tints on quotes.
renderer_guidance.timeline: Connection lines thin (2px), gradient from blue to burgundy. Nodes compact and uniform — progression through subtle color shifts, not size. Temporal markers precise and small. Print-ready aesthetic.
renderer_guidance.card_grid: Hero card with warm salmon background (#fff1e5). Standard cards with minimal borders, relying on spacing for separation. No dramatic shadows. Category indicators as small colored dots in palette colors.
renderer_guidance.stats: Numbers in sans-serif (Metric style), weight 600, deep blue. Labels small and precise. Stats arranged compactly — works at small column width. Financial-journal aesthetic.

influences.tradition_note: This approach represents the mature tradition of financial journalism graphics, refined over decades to serve readers who need rapid, accurate comprehension of economic data. The style balances information density with visual clarity, optimized for both print and digital contexts.
